name: Reuben Pinwheels
author: Laura Pitaniello
summary: Delicious, pretty appetizer. Perfect for any party. They usually go very quickly too! Serve with Thousand Island dressing or a mustard dip.
ingredients: 1 (17.5 ounce) package frozen puff pastry, thawed
2 tablespoons caraway seeds, or to taste
directions: Dust a flat work surface lightly with flour
Unroll puff pastry sheets; roll each out into a 10x15-inch rectangle
Spread a thin layer of Dijon mustard over puff pastry
Cover mustard with a layer of pastrami slices, followed by a layer of Swiss cheese slices
Roll puff pastry up tightly like a jelly roll
Wrap in plastic wrap and refrigerate for 1 hour, or up to 24 hours
Preheat oven to 350 degrees F (175 degrees C)
Line 2 baking sheets with parchment paper
Slice puff pastry rolls into 1/4-inch-thick slices and lay on the prepared baking sheets
Brush tops with beaten egg and sprinkle with caraway seeds
Bake in the preheated oven until pastry is lightly browned, about 12 minutes
Let sit for 1 minute on baking sheet before removing
